Camera-handler¶

This module is used to handle Vivotek fisheye lens camera.

It consists of methods in order to
  • retrieve images directly from the camera (download_image_to_file)
  • retrieve stream
  • set exposure level (set_exposure_level)
  • set gain (set_gain)
  • set IR cut mode (cut_filter_mode)
  • draw basic text (date,time,location-string) to image (add_text)
  • calculate solar position (solar_data)
Package requirements:
PIL, urllib2

Please care about the access to the camera via command-line and set proxies if needed.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/urllib.html https://docs.python.org/2/library/urllib2.html

Thomas Schmidt 05/2015

src.camera.solar_data(dates, lat, lon)[source]¶

Simple solar position algorithm.

Parameters:
  • dates (list) – list of datetime objects (must be in UTC)
  • lat (float) – latitude (degrees)
  • lon – longitude (degrees)
Returns:

dictionary with ‘sza’ - solar zenith angle (degrees) ‘saz’ - solar azimuth angle (degrees) ‘INull’ - extraterrestrial radiation (W/m^2)

Note

Formulas from Spencer (1972) and can be also found in “Solar energy fundamentals and modeling techniques” from Zekai Sen

class src.camera.vivotek(ip='', http=None, https=None, user='', passwd='')[source]¶

This methods are written for Vivotek FE8172V/FE8174V camera. The camera uses cgi-scripts to handle some settings like exposure time, gain, etc. Be careful to set only values that are accepted by the camera, otherwise nothing will happen or errors occur.

addText(img, dt=None, loc='')[source]¶

Adds some text into the image ( timestamp, name )

Params img:image object
Params dt:datetime, optional, date and time to draw in image corners
Params loc:string, optional, string to draw in image corner
cut_filter_mode(mode='day')[source]¶

Sets IR cut filter mode for Vivotek network camera

Parameters:mode – str, optional IR cut mode: “day” (default), “night”, “auto”, “di”, “schedule”
download_image_to_file(filename=None)[source]¶

Store the url content to filename

Parameters:

filename –

string, optional

path + filename for output image, if not given the basename of the url is used as filename and image is stored at current directory.
Returns flag:

boolean

True if saving was successful, otherwise False
set_exposure_level(level=-1)[source]¶

Sets exposure level for Vivotek network camera

Parameters:level – int, optional Exposure between 0-12, 6 is equal to neutral If level is not given, the default (=6) is set. Can be used to reset settings
set_exposure_time(maxexposure=-1, minexposure=-1)[source]¶

Sets exposure time for Vivotek network camera

Parameters:maxexposure (minexposure,) –

int, optional

Exposure time range Possible values: 5, 15, 25, 50, 100, 200, 250, 500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, 16000, 32000
set_gain(maxgain=None, mingain=None)[source]¶

Sets gain for Vivotek network camera

Params maxgain:int, optional, maximum gain, default 100
Params mingain:int, optional, minimum gain, default 0
